Posts.Content: Bill_From_Bham wrote: I want to tell you all that I really appreciate the wealth of wisdom I have found here.  My wife was diagnosed with Stage IIIA in May, went through TCH chemo June through September, and finally had a BMX last week.  You folks have really given me the information I needed to help her get through all this, and I can tell you that her pathology report came in yesterday with no sign of cancer in the lymph nodes that were excised!  So we are going to have a great Thanksgiving.  Might I ask my first questions here: if physical therapy is sought to help her regain her range of motion, when should this begin?  And for that matter, can anyone advise how to find a physical therapist that would handle this, or recommend one in the Birmingham, AL area?
